title: It must be Indiana Jones
content:
I realize that the sample is a bit blown out, but hopefully you smart people can offer a few suggestions. I’m looking to match this bold condensed serif for a customer. Berthold Sorbonne has some of the characteristics, as does Cooper Oldstyle Bold, but neither is a direct hit.

Thanks in advance.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828113155im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/indianajones2_6586.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828113155im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/indiana_jones_and_the_temple_of_doom_ver3_5557.jpg)

 [‹ Chancery](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828113155/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42275 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Italy, early 1900 serif face - Ronaldson Oldstyle {Akira} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828113155/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37485 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Grant Hutchinson

comments.content: It definitely looks like a variant of Cooper Oldstyle, but not one I’ve ever seen before. Maybe something from the later years of Headliners or Photo-Lettering Inc.?
Thanks Mark. I couldn’t locate anything in my collection of PLINC or Headliners reference, so I’ve suggested Cooper Oldstyle as the closest match.
